grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 踏破【トウハ】travelling on foot, traveling on foot, travelling all over
踏襲【トウシュウ】following (a precedent, former policy, etc.), continuing with, sticking to, observing
前人未到【ゼンジンミトウ】untrodden (region, field of study, etc.), unprecedented (discovery, achievement, etc.)
高踏【コウトウ】highbrow, aloof, transcendent
kun reading compounds: 踏む【ふむ】to step on, to tread on, to trample on, to set foot on (e.g. foreign soil), to stand on, to visit, to experience, to undergo, to follow (rules, principles, etc.), to go through (e.g. formalities), to complete, to estimate, to guess, to judge, to value, to appraise, to rhyme, to succeed to (e.g. the throne)
踏まえる【ふまえる】to be based on, to take into account, to build upon, to have origin in, to have one's feet firmly planted on, to plant oneself on
